subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Review charts for Shavian Quikscript Extensions
msgSnippet: ... I really prefer ZHIVAGO to J-AI. ... The Roadmap Committee has agreed to those two columns, too. This is not a bad thing. :-) ... Good. ... I m inclined to
messageBody:
At 06:55 -0700 2007-11-01, oliver langan wrote:

>With regards to letter names, I think that sticking with the
>originals in the manual is good (even if the names are not
>themselves ideal). However, in the proposal.txt file I note that
>letter J'AI is spelled with an apostrophe, and I believe it needs to
>be a hyphen (J-AI). That probably needs to be cleared up if this is
>not a shared code point (see my point below).

I really prefer ZHIVAGO to J-AI.

>I also found Michael's first-page table to be a bit confusing, but
>it seems to me that it simply illustrates the commonality between
>the two scripts. The table on the second page lists only the
>quickscript letters which are not common. This would be the chart
>that is submitted with the proposal, I believe.

The Roadmap Committee has agreed to those two columns, too. This is
not a bad thing. :-)

>I agree that utter should be shared with ado despite the confusion
>of Shavian also having up, two symbols for essentially the same
>sound.

Good.

>It seems to me there might be two extra candidates for merging: pea and j'ai.

I'm inclined to disagree with this.

>While these certainly look a bit different between Shavian and
>QuickScript, they are almost as similar as the foot and
>ooze characters are to their Shavian counterparts, and could
>possibly be seen as slight variations on the same glyph.

I disagree. There are essentially two additional strokes to each in
PEA and ZHIVAGO than in PEEP and MEASURE.

>Certainly, there is chance for confusion between, say, QuickScript
>thaw and Shavian peep,

I don't really agree with that assessment either.

> but given the other cases where the same glyph is used for totally
>different sounds I think that is only a minor issue. I think these
>glyphs are 'close enough' in shape while having the same sound.

I'd say the real questionable disunification is MIME and NUN from AH and AWE.
--
Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com

I really prefer ZHIVAGO to J-AI.

>I also found Michael's first-page table to be a bit confusing, but

The Roadmap Committee has agreed to those two columns, too. This is 
not a bad thing. :-)

>I agree that utter should be shared with ado despite the confusion

Good.

>It seems to me there might be two extra candidates for merging: pea and j'ai.

I'm inclined to disagree with this.

>While these certainly look a bit different between Shavian and 
>QuickScript, they are almost as similar as the foot and 
>ooze characters are to their Shavian counterparts, and could 
>possibly be seen as slight variations on the same glyph.

I disagree. There are essentially two additional strokes to each in 
PEA and ZHIVAGO than in PEEP and MEASURE.

>Certainly, there is chance for confusion between, say, QuickScript 
>thaw and Shavian peep,

I don't really agree with that assessment either.

>  but given the other cases where the same glyph is used for totally 
>different sounds I think that is only a minor issue.  I think these

I'd say the real questionable disunification is MIME and NUN from AH and AWE.

Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com
